title: Unable to open OR uninstall Firefox.
content:
Unable to open OR uninstall Firefox. Error Msg: the procedure entry point Flush could not be located in the dynamic link library C/Prog Files / Mozilla / Firefox / xul.dll

Huge thanks for any help!
creator: yofloro

title: After hundreds of visits, firefox won't connect to www.archive.org because "connection is not secure".
content:
I go to www.archive.org on a regular basis. Now though, all I get is a blank screen and when I click on the small figure at the address bar, I get the meassage "Connection not secure"

Why is this suddenly happening? In the week since I was there last, I have not changed any hardware or software.

Even though I discovered that "private mode" will get to that page, I like to keep my history file complete for when I need to refind something. I don't want to have to start using ":private mode" for browsing.

I really don't care if it is not a secure site. I trust it and want to go there. How do I override this so I can get back to a site that I have visited hundreds of times before this problem showed up?

BTW, cookies and caches have been cleared out. The computer has been rebooted. My internet connection has been reset (several times). The results have not changed. None of my other frequently visited sites does this. Only www.archive.org

Thank you.
creator: 1of8billion

title: Browser vs Inspector page file access
content:
Recently we were asked to add a couple of js scripts to some old framed pages where each script should exist only once in the page. The site is dynamic, by which I mean different content is sent to the browser depending on any of a collection of conditions. In reviewing the results after adding the scripts, there was an issue of script duplication but there was also a difference in how the results were being evaluated: 1: using view page and/or frame source in the browser and 2: using the page inspector from within the browser.

The sources showed one instance of each script - but the inspector showed duplication. ALSO, surprising to me, while the inspector showed the frames structure, it also showed the full page content of the main frame's web page in the noframes section of the overall container page. In other words, the noframes section included the doc-type and head section of the main frame's page. This seems confusing because the webserver does not deliver the doc-type and head section of the noframes section's content.

My question is what are the differences in the way that the browser and the inspector access page files? In this case, the sources of both the overall container page and the frame only source of the main content frame both seem good, no duplication; however, the inspector shows both possible instances of the scripts.

Probably could have asked more clearly - sorry lol - and thanks
creator: hav

title: Custom Font
content: For the last several years I have had Firefox configured to display all website fonts in my custom font, Dyslexie. As of upgrading to v119 yesterday, I have lost this function; all websites now display their native fonts. I still have Firefox Settings Default Font set to Dyslexie, but it no longer works. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: stalfnzo

title: Firefox is displaying incoming emails on my screen while I'm trying to read my emails. This is annoying as it often blocks what I'm trying to read.  Please cease this.
content: I would like you to stop displaying notifications of incoming emails while I'm reading my other emails. These notifications block what I'm trying to read and they are irritating and annoying.
creator: judith.parkinson

title: Firefox browser opens links in an emptied profile instead of an already open window
content: When clicking a link to a website, it opens my default browser, which is firefox, but it opens a new window with no add-ons, custom settings, cookies, a blank browser. After the recent update as of 3 November 2023, all my add-ons and settings were completely reset, as well as bookmarks all deleted, so I created a new profile to save all my settings. The new window that gets opened does not have any cookies, so it is not logged into anything. It also cannot combine with my other firefox windows and tabs.
creator: enmaaishaqt

title: Thingspeak access blocked on and off due to "security certificate" issues.
content: On a number of occasions over the years, I have been unable to log in to Thingspeak from my lap-top. Usually the problem goes away. This is stated as a problem with their security certificate. However, my tablet, also running Firefox (119.0.1) has no problem accessing my account. What is really the problem? I am running Windows 7 on my ancient lap-top (yes, I know it is way outdated, but I'm attached to it and rely on the security software I'm paying for) The tablet is running Android 8.1.0 and is my last resort for internet. Would really like to fix this.
creator: robertsk65

title: Links on some websites will not work in Firefox
content:
I would like to know why Firefox will not open links on certain websites. I am able to browse to these sites just fine. However, while navigating through said sites, sometimes links will not open. They do open in MS Edge and Google Chrome. One example is on the Kreg Tool website - https://www.kregtool.com/shop/workspace/bench-system-components/universal-bench-base-with-standard-height-legs/BENCH-BASE-STANDARD.html - I am not able to select the bench size from the drop down list. Firefox goes into a loop then I have to refresh to get out of the loop. Hopefully someone can explain this or provide a workaround.

Thanks much.

Dwane
creator: dwane37837

creator: Stray6678

title: Cannot make Firefox work.  "Firefox is already running, but is not responding."
content:
I cannot get Firefox to work. It keeps saying ""Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." I've tried all the solutions I found by searching- forced to use the Edge browser. (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-already-running-not-responding)

The Task manager does not show Firefox (or Mozilla) running. I've uninstalled Firefox several times, restarted my computer (Windows 10) each time. When I reinstall Firefox, I get the same message. 

 I can't use the troubleshooter because I can't open the program.

What else can I try? 

Thanks for any help!  (all my bookmarks, passwords, etc. are there).
creator: denaf1

title: Random Hang During Browsing - Hard Drive light On Solid
content:
Hello,

I tend to have a fair amount of windows and tabs open but this doesn't seem to have a noticed correlation. The symptoms are that FF will just go catatonic (spinning circle, Not Responding Header). When this happens the hard drive light is on solid. Eventually (10s of seconds to several minutes) FF will return to operation. Any idea of what is happening and how to fix this?
creator: Steve_Sr.
